page.title: 06Woodlesford Station
page.content: Local councillors and residents are fighting the proposed closure of Woodlesford Station.It was announced in February that the station on the Leeds/Wakefield line was to be closed.Closing stations at Woodlesford and Oulton would save British Rail about Â£900,000 a year.The decision has been opposed by the local rail uses who are angry at the threat to the station.Petitions have been organized,and letters written to those involved in the decision.Councillor Hudson says,"The decision has been taken without the Passenger transport executive listerning to the views of local people.The Labour Party have asked local M.P.Bill O'Brien to help over the proposed closure of the station.They took the decision purely on financial grounds but this is not just a financial matter.
